oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Charley Pride - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Charley Pride (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date. Tape is labeled part two of two.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Charley Pride; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mississippi Cotton Picking Delta Town [featuring Charley Pride and Rick Phillips voiceover] (Charley Pride) -- (00:37) Amazing Love [featuring Rick Phillips voiceover] (Charley Pride) -- (00:00) Hallmarks of Country Music introduction tune [featuring Rick Phillips voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:46) Pure Love [featuring Ronnie Milsap blind peoples radio spot] (Ronnie Milsap) -- (02:39) Rick Phillips and Charley Pride discuss Pride's time performing in Germany for the troops -- (03:57) Phillips inquires about people's initial reaction to Pride's appearance -- (05:35) For the Good Times (Charley Pride) -- (09:00) Unidentified tune [featuring Dean Jones commercial spot] ([Unidentified]) -- (10:00) I'd Rather Love You (Charley Pride) -- (12:44) Phillips asks Pride to reflect on the predominantly southern-white roots -- (16:30) She's Too Good to be True (Charley Pride) -- (19:16) Police commercial radio spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (20:14) Oklahoma Morning (Charley Pride) -- (23:21) Phillips inquires as to how Pride discovered "Amazing Love;" additionally, Pride comments on his inability to meet with his fans -- (26:58) A Shoulder to Cry On (Charley Pride) -- (29:58) A Volunteer commercial radio spot featuring an unidentified voice -- (30:33) Crystal Chandeliers (Charley Pride) -- (33:20) Military commercial radio spot featuring an unidentified host -- (34:31) Don't Fight the Feelings of Love (Charley Pride) -- (36:29) Phillips inquires about the differences Pride experiences from large to small shows -- (38:52) It's Gonna Take a Little Bit Longer (Charley Pride) -- (41:25) U. S. Customs commercial radio spot featuring an unidentified host -- (42:00) Then Who Am I (Charley Pride) -- (44:07) International Guild for Infant Survival commercial radio spot featuring an unidentified host -- (44:45) Standing in My Way (Charley Pride) -- (47:31) Phillips inquires as to what goals Pride has at this point in his life -- (49:03) Oklahoma Morning (Charley Pride) -- (51:47) Phillips introduces "We Could" -- (51:54) We Could (Charley Pride) -- (54:18) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
